decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: ND/JA/00 (Location Plan), ND/JA/01 (Block Plan), ND/JA/02 (Existing First Floor & Roof Plan), ND/JA/03 (Existing Front & Side Elevations), ND/JA/04 (Existing Rear & Side Elevations), ND/JA/06 (Approved Roof Plan), ND/JA/07 (Proposed First Floor Plan), ND/JA/08 Rev A (Proposed Loft Plan), ND/JA/09 (Proposed Roof Plan), ND/JA/10 (Proposed Front & Side Elevations), ND/JA/11 (Proposed Rear & Side Elevations), ND/JA/12 (Proposed Front Garden), ND/JA/13 (Existing Section), ND/JA/14 (Proposed Section).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, cycle storage for a minimum of four (4) cycles shall be provided within the curtilage of the site, within a secure, lockable compound.  These facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained permanently.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Ealing Sustainable Transport SPG and policy T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Refuse and recycling storage shall be provided within the front curtilage of the site, in line with the Local Planning Authority Standards and shall comprise bins for waste separation into non-recyclable, recyclable and food waste and shall thereafter be retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A and 74 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies SI7, SI8 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).
| No part of the roofs of the proposed dwellinghouse shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms/bedspace adjoining/below the communal main entrance and above/below kitchen/living/dining/bathroom of separate dwellings. The assessment and mitigation measures shall have regard to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.
Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies D14 of the London Plan and Standard 30 of the Housing SPG.
| During the implementation of the development hereby approved, control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented and adhere to:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),

- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison, - public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works in case of emergencies or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD.
description: Conversion of existing first floor residential unit into two self-contained residential units facilitated by rear roof extension to main roofslope; part roof extension to rear outrigger roofslope incorporating two Juliet balconies; and installation of two rooflights to front roofslope
